modules.description: This module provides a `set` operation to configure socket options on IPv6 multicast sockets, specifically handling domain-specific socket types. It works with socket objects and socket option types defined in the `Ipv6_multicast` and `Ipv6_multicast_lwt.Socket` modules. A concrete use case is setting multicast interface or loopback options on an IPv6 socket to control packet transmission behavior.

This module provides functions to create and manage IPv6 multicast sockets using Lwt for asynchronous networking. It supports operations for joining and leaving multicast groups, setting socket options, and sending and receiving multicast datagrams. The module works directly with IPv6 addresses and socket types defined in the `Ipv6_multicast` module, enabling concrete use cases such as implementing multicast-based discovery protocols or real-time data distribution over IPv6 networks.

This module enables IPv6 multicast communication over UDP with asynchronous I/O using Lwt, offering functions to bind, connect, send, and receive datagrams with support for source-specific multicast and optional flags. It works with `Cstruct.t` and `Bytes.t` buffers, allowing direct multicast transmission and reception while integrating socket configuration through submodules. One submodule provides operations to set socket options like multicast interface and loopback behavior, enabling precise control over packet transmission. Another submodule handles socket creation, group membership management, and asynchronous multicast I/O, supporting use cases such as real-time data distribution and multicast-based service discovery over IPv6 networks.
